definitions:
(transitive) To love, to have great affection for.

Graças a você, agora nos conhecemos, nos casamos e nos amamos. — “Thanks to you, now we met, we married and we love each other.”

(intransitive) To have the ability to love, to feel love.

Pobre homem, em todos esses oitenta anos nunca amou de verdade. — “Poor man, in all those eighty years, never really loved.”
First-person singular (eu) future subjunctive of amar
Third-person singular (ele, ela, also used with tu and você?) future subjunctive of amar
First-person singular (eu) personal infinitive of amar
Third-person singular (ele, ela, also used with tu and você?) personal infinitive of amar
description: amar (first-person singular present indicative amo, past participle amado)
etymology: From Old Portuguese amar, from Latin amāre, present active infinitive of amō (“I love”), from Proto-Indo-European [Term?].
